author: Jessica Gorst-Williams
title: 'Scottish Power won’t listen to me'
text: I doubt that the contact for my Scottish Power complaint even read the information I submitted on this. Can you get the company to listen? DP, Cheshire Presuming you had been double-billed on the final amount you had paid Scottish Power before you left it, you tried again and again to get a proper breakdown of the figures. Many months later, having had no success, you wrote to me. • 'Why has my £1,305 credit disappeared, Scottish Power?' The answer is that, while you were beginning the transfer process, you cancelled your monthly direct debit. This meant that your account reverted to a standard tariff. Your final £111 bill included five days of charges on the original fixed-price rate and 40 on standard rates. This was taken off your £331 credit balance, with the £220 difference being paid by cheque. Because this explanation has been so slow in coming Scottish Power has paid £50 to you. • If you want to contact Jessica, click here telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraph Telegraph Home Insurance Get a Quote: » Up to 25% discount for over 50's
